I really like how easy it is to make a live image of Fedora with this media tool. It feels a lot more intuitive than Ubuntu's startup disk creator, but I feel that this app could use a few more options and make it easy for the user to include data persistence, persistent overlay, and other options available in command line tools. Overall, this is still a great app, and I can't wait to see more from it.
summary: Has a lot of potential, but could do more

description:
Easily one of the simplest tools to create Fedora installation keys with. Saves you the trouble of downloading most variants, and will even reformat your USB after it's been writen to. It is slow to roll out new versions, though. For example, Fedora Kinoite still isn't an option (but should be by the next release.)

It would be nice to add an iso imaging function to "save" usb data as an iso prior to overwriting it, though that's definitely not a priority.
Used it to write fedora to a USB and it did the job
Dont even spend your time trying it.
моргенштерн стопламерс
its quick and fast
My installation media was written in 5 clicks - including installation of this application. Simply thank you.

If you want a Fedora USB this is perfect. It is also just fine for writing any other .iso files. I don't know what more you could ask for. If it's not good enough for you, you probably already know how to use dd.
Worked well with a Fedora ISO, but having trouble with mounting and write permission trying to burn a different distro.
Great app. Wish it had an option for writing Fedora to a Pinebook Pro eMMC through the "Download automatically" Select Image Source section.

Simple, easy, and fricking awesome.
Used it twice so far.
Looking forward to use it even more!

One of the best media writers, especially since it can write installable Windows images without errors.
